title: Retire a license model
content:
Note You must have the appropriate permissions to be able to retire a license model.

If you retire a license model, this has no effect on existing license records.

To retire a license model means changing its status, as shown in the workflow snapshot at the top of the model, from Active to Inactive.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Software Asset > License Models.
  2. Select the license model.
  3. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.
  4. Click Move to: Inactive.

    If the system finds a linked version, you'll see the "Failed to deactivate this license model because it's linked to a product that's still using the license" message when moving the license model to the INACTIVE phase. In this case, decouple all the relationships between this license model and all linked product versions, and then deactivate the license model. 
    The error message pops up because there is an out-of-the-box business rule for checking if any product version links to this asset model. You can check this rule in Studio (AssetModel > Normal > Active > Active > Transition: Active -> Inactive).

  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.
